argument.value: A boolean can be used to control if the ripple directive should be active or not. You can provide an object with a `class` property to have that class applied to the ripple container element.

modifiers.center: Makes it so that the ripple originates from the center of the element, instead where the user clicked on it.
modifiers.circle: Changes the ripple behavior to better match circular elements.
modifiers.stop: Prevents ripples from being triggered on any other elements when the click event is bubbling up.
